body:
Comment 5: 
This syntax change adds no expressibility to the language. In fact it would be a more
verbose version of an 
existing feature.

The var keyword has use in clarifying the syntax outside of functions and occasionally
to be clear about variables 
that will be assigned later.  Using it inside the init clause of a for loop is needless.

There's just no need for this change in idiomatic Go code.
_Status changed to **WontFix**._
